E. G. White: No, it is not. All I can say is that 
                                                                           274
I have had very distinct light, however, that there is danger of our limiting the power of the Holy One of Israel, in connection with certain plans for connecting our schools with worldly methods. He is the God of the universe, and our influence is dependent upon our carrying out the precepts of His word. We weaken our powers by not placing our dependence upon God, and taking hold of His strength. This is our privilege.
